Beyond the perpendiculars which form the boundaries
of the arch there are usually <s>a<\s> comparatively narrow
bands in which the <s>direction<\s> dip of the folia is irregular,
these are succeeded by <s>an<\s>other perpendicular planes
usually parallel to the first, which form<s>s<\s> the boundar<s>y<\s>ies
of <s>an<\s>other arches standing on each side of the
first, but which are often incomplete. As the
planes & curved surfaces are extended <s>across the [text?]<\s> in the direction
of the strike, each arch <s>as<\s> here represented is
the section of a semi-cylinder, <s>of which the length
has still to be observed<\s> which is often of great length.
The perpendicular planes of foliation frequently
run along important ridges of hills, which <s>in
addition to the greater distinctness of their folds <\s> has <s>often<\s> brought
them into notice; while the lower & flatter central
portions, in which the general arrangement is
disguised by the contortions, have attracted less attention.
